title: The top producer at '60 Minutes' has quit. He says he can no longer run the show as he always has
‘That ends now’: Judge overseeing Abrego Garcia case knocks Trump administration for repeated stonewalling
Global growth forecast slashed by IMF over tariff impact
description: The US suffers the biggest downgrade to growth among advanced economies, in the influential International Monetary Fund's latest forecast.

title: World leaders from Trump to Zelensky to attend Pope's funeral
description: The pontiff's body will lie in St Peter's Basilica from Wednesday until Friday to allow mourners to pay their respects.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Tesla reports 20% drop in auto revenue as first-quarter results miss Wall Street estimates
description: Tesla's first-quarter earnings report lands as investors reckon with a steep slide in the company's stock price.

title: Trump says he has 'no intention' of firing Fed Chair Powell
description: Powell, whom Trump appointed Fed chair during his first term as president, has flatly stated that the president cannot remove him under the law.

title: Pope Will Lie in State for Three Days Before Funeral on Saturday
description: President Trump and President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine are among the world leaders who plan to attend the funeral. The conclave to choose his successor will most likely start at least a week later.
author: The New York Times

title: Pope Francis’ Death Silences a Voice for the Voiceless
description: As democratic values and alliances were being turned upside down, the pope was a consistent moral guidepost. Who can play that role now?
author: Jason Horowitz
categories: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

title: Elon Musk Says He Will Reduce Work For Trump As Tesla Profits Drop 71%
description: Elon Musk plans to "significantly" reduce his work for Donald Trump's administration in May to focus on Tesla, the billionaire CEO said Tuesday.

title: Trump Says He Has "No Intention" Of Firing Fed Chief
description: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday he had no plans to fire the Federal Reserve chief, in apparently conciliatory remarks after berating him and triggering market turmoil.

title: New Jersey wildfire burns 1,200 acres, prompts evacuations
description: A rapidly spreading wildfire in Barnegat Township, New Jersey, has forced mandatory evacuations as it consumes 1,200 acres. The New Jersey Forest Fire Service reports the fire is uncontained, threatening sixteen structures. The Garden State Parkway is closed near Exit 69, and firefighting crews are battling the blaze with aerial support. The cause is currently under investigation.
author: TOI World Desk

title: Russian artist reveals 'mystery' Trump portrait gifted by Putin to US president
description: A portrait of Donald Trump, commissioned by the Kremlin and gifted by Vladimir Putin, depicts the former president's resilience after a failed assassination attempt. Artist Nikas Safronov aimed to capture Trump's bravery, highlighting his connection with America. Putin believed the portrait would improve relations between Russia and the United States.
author: TOI World Desk

title: ‘The devil wants this pattern of mass death repeated’: Actors Guild of Nigeria calls for better regulation after two actors die
description: After two actors died in Owerri, Imo State, AGN head Emeka Rollas drew comparisons to events last year, when popular Nollywood actor Junior Pope drownedThe president of the Actors Guild of Nigeria has called for mass prayers and increased unionisation after the death of two actors in Owerri, the capital city of Imo State.Posting on Instagram, Emeka Rollas advocated spiritual intervention and better workplace regulation to try to prevent future tragedies after the two men, who have not yet been named, died on Friday. Continue reading...
author: Catherine Shoard

title: ‘I hope I’ll one day be at peace’: civilians seek mental health help in war-ravaged eastern DRC
description: People traumatised by conflict have queued outside the Saint Vincent de Paul neuropsychiatric hospital in Goma each day since free scheme launchedOn a sunny morning in the city of Goma in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, where fighting between the M23 rebel group and the Congolese army raged earlier this year, men and women rushed towards a line of chairs outside a medical facility.Since 24 March, the Saint Vincent de Paul neuropsychiatric hospital, a medical facility for people with mental health issues, has been offering free consultations on a first-come first-served basis for people affected by the fighting. Dozens have lined up to be seen each day. Continue reading...
author: Prosper Heri Ngorora in Goma and Carlos Mureithi in Nairobi

title: Trump administration unwinds efforts to investigate Russian war crimes
description: The Trump administration has backed away from several initiatives intended to hold Moscow accountable for war crimes in Ukraine, including an intelligence coordinator office.
author: Ellen Nakashima

title: U.S. proposes recognizing Crimea as Russian ahead of new round of talks
description: Ukraine and its European allies will be meeting with top U.S. officials in London on Wednesday to discuss the proposals, which may not sit well with Kyiv.
author: Siobhán O'Grady, John Hudson, Steve Hendrix
